paragraphs.content: Psalm 109
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 109

paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

paragraphs.content: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

paragraphs.content: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

paragraphs.content: For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.

paragraphs.content: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

paragraphs.content: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.

paragraphs.content: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

paragraphs.content: Let his days be few; and let another take his office.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let his days be few; and let another take his office.

paragraphs.content: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

paragraphs.content: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.

paragraphs.content: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.

paragraphs.content: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.

paragraphs.content: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

paragraphs.content: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the LORD; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the Lord; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

paragraphs.content: Let them be before the LORD continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let them be before the Lord continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

paragraphs.content: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

paragraphs.content: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

paragraphs.content: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

paragraphs.content: Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.

paragraphs.content: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the LORD, and of them that speak evil against my soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the Lord, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

paragraphs.content: But do thou for me, O GOD the Lord, for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But do thou for me, O God the Lord, for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.

paragraphs.content: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

paragraphs.content: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

paragraphs.content: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

paragraphs.content: I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.

paragraphs.content: Help me, O LORD my God: O save me according to thy mercy:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Help me, O Lord my God: O save me according to thy mercy:

paragraphs.content: That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, LORD, hast done it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, Lord, hast done it.

paragraphs.content: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

paragraphs.content: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

paragraphs.content: I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will greatly praise the Lord with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

paragraphs.content: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.
